alert.note: Alert for Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHERN ROCKBRIDGE COUNTY THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 250 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall between Vesuvius and Goshen, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall will result in ponding of water on roadways and minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cornwall... Fairfield... Brownsburg... Vesuvius... and Bells Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
